body_html:
Install pytorch thorugh pip3
sudo pip3 install http://download.pytorch.org/whl/cu75/torch-0.2.0.post1-cp35-cp35m-manylinux1_x86_64.whl
I am using Ubuntu 16.04 LTS. Installation through pip3 works perfectly. You'll will have to run it as root

Collecting torch==0.2.0.post1 from http://download.pytorch.org/whl/cu75/torch-0.2.0.post1-cp35-cp35m-manylinux1_x86_64.whl
Downloading http://download.pytorch.org/whl/cu75/torch-0.2.0.post1-cp35-cp35m-manylinux1_x86_64.whl (340.4MB)
100% |████████████████████████████████| 340.4MB 3.4MB/s
Requirement already satisfied: numpy in ./.local/lib/python3.5/site-packages (from torch==0.2.0.post1)
Requirement already satisfied: pyyaml in /usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages (from torch==0.2.0.post1)
Installing collected packages: torch
Successfully installed torch-0.2.0.post1

body:
Install pytorch thorugh pip3
``
sudo pip3 install http://download.pytorch.org/whl/cu75/torch-0.2.0.post1-cp35-cp35m-manylinux1_x86_64.whl 
``
I am using Ubuntu 16.04 LTS. Installation through pip3 works perfectly. You'll will have to run it as root
>Collecting torch==0.2.0.post1 from http://download.pytorch.org/whl/cu75/torch-0.2.0.post1-cp35-cp35m-manylinux1_x86_64.whl
